comment: While there seemed to be alot of work, there was a lot of freedom in picking project topics & method. I didn't have any trouble contacting professor Ao outside of class, & I always received feedback quickly in regards to class and non-class related inquiries. Group projects were a taxing & sometimes troublesome, but she is considerate.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--SO MANY PAPERS--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: Nice enough lady. Difficult to keep up with in class. Her finals are something else entirely. Would not be my first choice of the professors listed at KSU.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: She's very unorganized and doesn't adjust her teaching methods to students. Her methods are group based which I hate! She lost 2 of my character writings, counted me absent for a day I came, and randomly comes up with assignments last minute. I 100% would never take her again. She seems sweet at first but in then end she doesn't care about you.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: Too much about CHINA. I hope to explore more about other countries in East Asia.
rating_tags: LOTS OF HOMEWORK--SO MANY PAPERS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: This class was really cool, but not worth it. I wanted to expand my knowledge on Asian cultures to get a better understanding of the Asian pop culture I love, but this course was too much effort for an elective  class. BUT if you're taking this class because you need to Professor Ao is amazing and THERE ARE NO TESTS.
Ao Laoshi is friendly at first sight. She seems helpful but you won't get any helpful suggestions even if you communicated a lot with her. I won't take her classes in the future.

She is very friendly, you will always be welcomed into the class with a smile. She likes to provide interactive assignments that make it feel like you're not even in a class. There is heavy usage of power points and videos, interesting presenters come in when she's not available. Be weary though, Asian culture is mostly focused on Chinese culture.

Ao laoshi is such a great teacher. She truly helps her students to feel comfortable. Some language teachers quickly and roughly correct their students, which discourages them to speak up. But Ao laoshi helps to gently steer her students towards the correct grammar, pronunciation and vocab, therefore encouraging students to SPEAK CHINESE. Love her.

Ao laoshi is a great teacher she really wants you to learn the course and trust me you really do learn. The way she teaches makes use of the book but only to further what she is teaching. She gives a lot of examples for grammar and stuff and makes you extend your sentence to be better. So she does give a lot of work but its useful. Take her.

I loved Ao! She was so helpful and really wanted to get us interested in Chinese. Class was full of participation and she gave us lots of time to practice speaking in class. She also did some fun cultural activities which was nice! She's also very fair and flexible with making up quizzes if you are sick,etc

I tried my hardest in this class. I absolutely love different languages and she made me hate Chinese. She was unhelpful, even after sending you multiple emails, talking to her after class, and going to a tutor. I do not recommend her as a teacher. She is horrible in my opinion.
